greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = number of steps needed to reach (n^2)-1 when starting from k = ((n+1)^2)-1 and repeatedly applying the map that replaces k with k - A002828(k), where A002828(k) = the least number of squares that add up to k.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1024
mathematica: Table[Length[#] - 1 &@ NestWhileList[# - (If[First@ # > 0, 1, Length[ First@ Split@ #] + 1] &@ SquaresR[Range@ 4, #]) &, ((n + 1)^2) - 1, # != (n^2) - 1 &], {n, 95}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Sep 08 2016, after _Harvey P. Dale_ at A002828 *)
program: (Scheme, three variants, the first one utilizing memoization-macro definec)
xref: First differences of both A260732 and A260733.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 12 2015
